title: Bright spot on the skin
vignette: A pale patch appears on Miriam's arm and seems to spread.

options.text: Consult a priest immediately; it may be tzara'at.
Ignore it until it causes discomfort.

title: Locking suspected leper indoors
vignette: The town wants to confine a man with suspicious lesions to protect others.

options.text: Isolate him for the full observation period.
Let him stay home but move freely.

title: Streak appearing after burn
vignette: A burn heals but leaves a white streak. Does it count as a plague?

options.text: Yes if color and size fit the rule.
Injuries from burns are exempt from tzara'at.

title: Hair turned completely white
vignette: A patch of hair turns white overnight with no other signs.

options.text: White hair alone signals impurity.
Without underlying skin change it is pure.

title: House with greenish stains
vignette: Discoloration spreads on the inner wall of a home.

options.text: Remove the affected stones and scrape the walls.
Paint over it and continue living there.

title: Garment showing reddish threads
vignette: A wool cloak develops streaks of deep red.

options.text: Burn the garment to prevent spread.
Wash it several times and check again.

title: Closing a house for seven days
vignette: After examination, the priest orders the house sealed.

options.text: Obey and evacuate until reinspection.
Remain inside to guard belongings.

title: Leper's clothing left in the home
vignette: His garments remain indoors after he moves out for quarantine.

options.text: They convey impurity and must be burned.
Wash them thoroughly and reuse.

title: Infection during festival week
vignette: Signs of tzara'at appear during Sukkot celebrations.

options.text: Suspend inspection until after the festival.
Examine immediately despite the holiday.

title: Priest with poor eyesight
vignette: The only available priest has weak vision to assess lesions.

options.text: He may still rule if experienced.
Another priest must be found or trained.

title: Flaking skin after recovery
vignette: Following treatment, patches begin to flake off.

options.text: Consider it healed; no further impurity.
Reassess; flakes may signal active tzara'at.

title: Stone walls replaced twice
vignette: After a second scraping, discoloration returns yet again.

options.text: Demolish the entire house now.
Try scraping a third time before demolishing.

title: Person with lesion travels abroad
vignette: A man with suspicious marks leaves Israel before a priest rules.

options.text: He remains pure until examined in the land.
His departure renders him impure by default.

title: Shared courtyard with a leper
vignette: Neighbors debate whether the suspected leper may use the communal courtyard.

options.text: Restrict his access to avoid contamination.
Permit limited use with precautions.

title: Signs disappear before priest arrives
vignette: By the time the priest schedules a visit, the marks have faded.

options.text: He is pure unless symptoms return.
Still count the first appearance as impure.
